result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Reuben E Sturdivant

records.addlTxt:
10:00 AM cases 21CF395, 21CT361, 22CF27 called. Prosecuting Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Reuben E Sturdivant in court with Attorney Jay E. Heit. Attorney Heit states the defendant needs to complete community service hours for DAGP to not be revoked and is requesting additional time to do so. State indicated that offer may be rescinded due to extension being requested again.
Hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant needs 40 hours community service completed by next date.

Hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 9:30 am.

Hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Jay Heit at $100/hr.  Defendant shall reimburse Eau Claire County by making payments of $100 beginning 01/07/2022 and every 30 days thereafter.  Payment shall not exceed the full cost of representation.
